title: Table student scores scattergrams represent data

content.question: A cognitive psychologist is interested in examining whether the type of math class is related to the effectiveness of a new study strategy. Which of the following scattergrams represents the data as depicted in the data set?

choices.label: Each choice shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis of each graph shows the semester average for algebra with 50 on the left and 100 on the right. The vertical axis of each graph shows the test score for statistics with 50 on the bottom and 100 on the top. Choice A has all of the plotted points concentrated in the center of the graph, new 75 on each axis.

Each choice shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis of each graph shows the semester average for algebra with 50 on the left and 100 on the right. The vertical axis of each graph shows the test score for statistics with 50 on the bottom and 100 on the top. Choice B has the plotted points nearly forming a line that starts in the upper left corner, near 50 on the horizontal axis and 100 on the vertical axis, and goes down and to the right, ending near 100 on the horizontal axis and 50 on the vertical axis.

Each choice shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis of each graph shows the semester average for algebra with 50 on the left and 100 on the right. The vertical axis of each graph shows the test score for statistics with 50 on the bottom and 100 on the top. Choice C has points spread evenly across the graph.

Each choice shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis of each graph shows the semester average for algebra with 50 on the left and 100 on the right. The vertical axis of each graph shows the test score for statistics with 50 on the bottom and 100 on the top. Choice D has the plotted points nearly forming a line that starts in the lower left corner, near 50 on the horizontal axis and 50 on the vertical axis, and goes up and to the right, ending near 100 on the horizontal axis and 100 on the vertical axis.

content.answer: Each choice shows a graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis of each graph shows the semester average for algebra with 50 on the left and 100 on the right. The vertical axis of each graph shows the test score for statistics with 50 on the bottom and 100 on the top. Choice D has the plotted points nearly forming a line that starts in the lower left corner, near 50 on the horizontal axis and 50 on the vertical axis, and goes up and to the right, ending near 100 on the horizontal axis and 100 on the vertical axis.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
